malicious_ips.description: Known credential attack source. Previously seen in password spray campaigns targeting SSH/RDP services.
Coordinated attack infrastructure. Part of distributed credential access campaign.
Known malicious IP associated with opportunistic password spraying attacks.
Residential IP used in credential access attempts. Likely compromised host or VPN exit node.
Active credential attack source. High volume password spray activity.
Related to 77.90.185.230. Part of same attack infrastructure.
Same /24 subnet as known malicious IPs. Lower volume but similar patterns.

attack_patterns.name: Password Spray Campaign - Q4 2025
attack_patterns.description: Large-scale password spray campaign targeting SSH/RDP services. Characterized by low-and-slow attempts across many accounts to avoid account lockout.

indicators.pattern: 1-3 attempts per account across 50+ distinct accounts

recommendations: Implement rate limiting on authentication endpoints
Enable MFA for all external access
Monitor for distributed attacks from multiple IPs

attack_patterns.name: Credential Stuffing - Automated
attack_patterns.description: Automated credential stuffing using leaked credential databases.

indicators.pattern: High velocity login attempts with valid username formats

recommendations: Force password resets for compromised accounts

attack_patterns.name: Post-Compromise Lateral Movement
attack_patterns.description: After successful credential theft, attackers attempt lateral movement within network.

indicators.pattern: Authentication from newly compromised account to multiple internal systems
indicators.timing: Often occurs within hours of credential compromise

threat_actors.name: Opportunistic Attackers
threat_actors.description: Unsophisticated threat actors using widely available tools for credential harvesting.
threat_actors.notes: These attacks are largely automated and not targeted.

T1110.name: Brute Force
T1110.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts.
T1110.detection: Monitor authentication logs for patterns of multiple failures
T1110.mitigation: Account lockout policies, MFA, rate limiting

T1110.003.name: Password Spraying
T1110.003.description: Try common passwords against many accounts to avoid account lockout.
T1110.003.detection: Low failure count per account but high distinct account count
T1110.003.mitigation: Complex password requirements, MFA, IP-based rate limiting

T1110.004.name: Credential Stuffing
T1110.004.description: Use credentials obtained from breaches to attempt access.
T1110.004.detection: Valid username formats, often automated patterns
T1110.004.mitigation: Breach monitoring, forced password resets, MFA

T1078.name: Valid Accounts
T1078.description: Adversaries use legitimate credentials to gain access.
T1078.mitigation: MFA, privileged access management, behavior analytics
